description.narrative: Mine action support to Yemen: institution building, capacity development and operations

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA)

activity-description.narrative: Additional contribution to support the implementation of Mine Action activities
Additional contribution to support the implementation of Mine Action activities

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

provider-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA)
United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA)
United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA)
United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA)

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1.1 Desk, technical and non-technical survey processes completed 1.2 Impact assessments completed 1.2 Timely production and dissemination of accurate contamination maps to stakeholders
2.1 Surface of land cleared through field clearance operations conducted according to national standards (both manual and dog detection teams). 2.2 Number of mines and UXO cleared according to national standards. 2.3 Number of mines and UXO destroyed according to national standards
3.1 Mine Risk Education events completed or coordinated by YEMAC 3.2 Number of people covered by MRE 3.3 Mine Risk Education events completed in all Governorates covered by Project activities
4.1 Number of survivors surveyed. 4.1 Number of survivors examined. 4.1 Number of survivors supported with medical aid.

comment.narrative:
Act1: YEMAC lacks sufficient technical knowledge to meet new threats and the capacity to deal with the spread of contamination
Act2: YEMAC lacks sufficient technical knowledge to meet new threats and the capacity to deal with the spread of contamination
Act3: YEMAC does not have full capacity to meet the increased needs across the country
Act4: YEMAC does not have full capacity to meet the increased needs across the country

Output 1: Achieve concrete changes in people’s lives by strengthening communities’ resilience and social cohesion by reaching its primary objective - The impact of mine and ERW contamination is reduced.
Output Indicator: 1.1 Desk, technical and non-technical survey processes completed 1.2 Impact assessments completed 1.3 Timely production and dissemination of accurate contamination maps to stakeholders
2.1 Surface of land cleared through field clearance operations conducted according to national standards (both manual and dog detection teams). 2.2 Number of mines and UXO cleared according to national standards. 2.3 Number of mines and UXO destroyed according to national standards

4.1 Number of survivors surveyed. 4.2 Number of survivors examined. 4.3 Number of survivors supported with medical aid.

Output 1 - Mine and UXO contamination is mapped and impact assessed using primary and secondary sources Output Indicators 1.1 Desk, technical and non-technical survey processes completed Result (cumulative at end of Q2): 68 field surveys 1.2. Impact assessments completed Result (cumulative at end of Q2): 0 1.3. Timely production and dissemination of accurate contamination maps to stakeholders Result (cumulative at end of Q2): 6 (regular monthly updates)
Output 2 - Mines and UXO are cleared in identified priority areas Output Indicators 2.1 Surface of land cleared through field clearance operations conducted according to national standards (both manual and dog detection teams). Result (cumulative at end of Q2): 1,526,484 2.2 Number of mines and UXO cleared according to national standards. Result (cumulative at end of Q2): 38,512 2.3 Number of mines and UXO destroyed according to national standards Result (cumulative at end of Q2): 0
Output 3 - The awareness of the threat posed by mines and UXO is increased in affected communities Output Indicators 3.1 Mine Risk Education events completed or coordinated by YEMAC Result (cumulative at end of Q2): not available 3.2 Number of people covered by MRE Result (cumulative at end of Q2): 27,512 3.3 Mine Risk Education events completed in all Governorates covered by Project activities Result (cumulative at end of Q2): not available
Output 4 - Survivors of ERW are more effectively supported and rehabilitated socio-economically Output Indicators 4.1. Number of survivors surveyed. Result (cumulative at end of Q2): 221 4.2. Number of survivors examined. Result (cumulative at end of Q2): 0 4.3. Number of survivors supported with medical aid. Result (cumulative at end of Q2): 0
